newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Merrill, Daiwa to lead S.African govt bond issues.
newsitem.headline: Merrill, Daiwa to lead S.African govt bond issues.

text.p: South Africa's Department of Finance said Friday that Merrill Lynch & Co had been appointed as lead manager of its planned Yankee bond issue and Daiwa Securities as lead manager of its planned Samurai issue.

Market conditions would determine the terms, conditions and timing of the two transactions which will form part of the government's budgeted amount of about 4.0 billion rand to be borrowed in foreign markets in 1997/98 (April-March).

"In keeping with the foreign borrowing strategy adopted in 1996, the emphasis will be on extending the maturity profile of foreign currency denominated debt, whilst at the same time further reaching out to new investors," the department said in a statement.
